name: php-formatter
description: A wrapper for the Sensiolabs PHP CS Fixer. Analyzes some PHP source code and tries to fix coding standards issues (PSR-1 and PSR-2 compatible).

commands.title: Fixes current file or selection if there is any.

phpformatter.pharPath.description: Should point to php-cs-fixer.phar file, if you have installed this manually (without Composer). Should include .phar extension.

phpformatter.phpPath.description: If the pharPath is set, and you are not using Composer, and you haven't added PHP to your PATH, this should point to the php.exe file.

phpformatter.composer.description: Whether the php-cs-fixer library has been installed using Composer. If true, the extension will override pharPath and assume you have added Composer to your PATH.

phpformatter.onSave.description: Whether files should be fixed on save.

phpformatter.level.description: Fixer level to use when fixing a file, e.g. psr0, psr1, psr2, symfony (https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/PHP-CS-Fixer#usage).

phpformatter.fixers.description: Fixers to use when fixing a file, e.g. strict, short_array_syntax (https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/PHP-CS-Fixer#usage).

phpformatter.additionalExtensions.description: Which additional file extensions, besides PHP, should be fixed as well. E.g. inc, without the leading dot. For this to work you'll also have to configure your VSCode files.associations settings (https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/languages/overview#_common-questions).

phpformatter.logging.description: If true, the extension will log all sorts of (debug) info to the console. Useful for troubleshooting.

phpformatter.notifications.description: If true, the extension will show notifications.

phpformatter.useTempFiles.description: [Experimental] If true, a temporary file will be created whenever the formatter is ran. The content of the file that is to be formatted will be copied to that temporary file. The formatter will then be run on the temporary file. This will circumvent a lot of issues that crop up when formatting the file directly (https://github.com/Dickurt/vscode-php-formatter/issues/1#issuecomment-232131434). Set this setting to false when you encounter issues, i.e. with permissions.
